page.title: 11YEOVIL COUNCIL_BRYMPTON
page.content: There are 9 members of the Brympton Parish Council and they meet each month to debate local issues including planning applications,playgrounds,street lighting,road and pathway conditions and amenities. The average age of councillors is 40 and most became members because they wanted to help the community.These numbers were recently increased to reflect the changes in population but some adjustment is still needed as one or two members represent a very rural area,with few people but still have a full vote.Some councillors felt that they could do more if they were not so tightly controlled by the district and county councils who did not fully understand local needs ,but much could be achieved given councillors with enough energy.
